artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Iwazō Katōya
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 65; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 299.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: detached triptych; two men sword fighting at R in front of black gate; man at R, in red, is about to strike down with his sword while dodging the sword of figure at C; man at UL on horseback charges at group of men with large spear
dimension:
14 7/16 × 9 3/4 in. (36.67 × 24.77 cm) (image, vertical ōban triptych)
14 5/8 × 10 in. (37.15 × 25.4 cm) (sheet)
markings: Artist’s seal: 芳桐 {Yoshikiri} | Censor seal: 戌五改
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
signed: 一魁斎芳年画 {Ikkaisai Yoshitoshi ga}
text: Settō Shi Hakkon 節頭司伯根, Saitō Izu-no-Nyūdō Ryūhon 佐井藤伊豆入道立尊, Satō Kiyomasa 佐藤清正.
title: Mashiba, the Tairyō, Subjugates Korea
